mechanics

Interface PoweredComponent


  • public interface PoweredComponent
    Signals in RedZone follow a set of simple rules, as detailed by the PoweredComponent interface. In RedZone, there are 64 levels of power. 0 is the lowest, and 63 is the highest. Powered components may generate any level of power, and will send a signal equal to that level of power minus one to all components that they connect to. This, in turn, will cause updated components to send a signal similarly, and so on until the system is at equilibrium.

    If you wish to implement this interface, be aware of these details:

    • Remember to set alwaystick to true, register the block with the fast block ticker, and call powerBump each fast tick. I tried, but I can't override class methods with an interface, so you'll have to do it yourself.
    • All sixteen metadata bits are reserved in RedZone components. The first 8 are reserved by DangerZone, the 9th is reserved for maintaining power status, the 10th is reserved for maintaining cycle updates, and the last 6 hold the current power level.
    • Metadata should not be manipulated directly. RedZone assumes that only it will be modifying the last eight bits of metadata, and violating this assumption causes undefined behavior.
    • Leave all the default methods alone unless you really know what you're doing.
    • Signals can only be sent to neighboring blocks. Trying to directly interface with components farther away is undefined behavior, and will cause component behavior to be at the mercy of game quirks.
    Author:
    eaglgenes101
    See Also:
    Wire, PowerStick, Dispenser, Dropper, SmokeTester, DetectorSwitch, PressSwitch, ProximityDetector

    • Method Detail

      • getPowerLevel

        default int getPowerLevel(dangerzone.World w,
                          int d,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int z)
        Returns a component's current power level. This method should be called directly to determine how much power a powered component has.
        Parameters:
        w - The world
        d - The dimension
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate
        Returns:
        The current power level of the block

      • basePowerLevel

        int basePowerLevel(dangerzone.World w,
                   int d,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int z)
        Determines how much power this component starts with each tick. This method is called by initStep to start each powered component off with a base level of power. Go ahead and use it for yourself.
        Parameters:
        w - The world
        d - The dimension
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate
        Returns:
        The power level of the block at the start of the tick (with default notifyNeighborChanged)

      • canConnect

        boolean canConnect(int dx,
                   int dy,
                   int dz,
                   int meta)
        Determines whether this block can send a signal to a block with the given displacement. This method is used to establish connections between active powered components. It can be assumed that dx, dy, and dz are all between -1 and 1, bit it's a good idea to check nevertheless.
        Parameters:
        dx - The x-displacement of the target to this block
        dy - The y-displacement of the target to this block
        dz - The z-displacement of the target to this block
        meta - The metadata of this block
        Returns:
        Whether this block can send power to the given block

      • setCycle

        default void setCycle(dangerzone.World w,
                      int d,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int z,
                      boolean shouldMatch)
        Set the cycle status of this block. This method should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        w - The world
        d - The dimension
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate
        shouldMatch - Whether the set cycle should match the clock cycle

      • getCycle

        default boolean getCycle(dangerzone.World w,
                         int d,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int z)
        Returns the block's cycle match status. This method should not be called directly.
        Parameters:
        w - The world
        d - The dimension
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        z - The z-coordinate
        Returns:

      • powerBump

        default void powerBump(dangerzone.World w,
                       int d,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int z)
        Causes a full power cycle to be initiated in all powered components that contiguous to it. This method should be called every fast tick.
